meanings.definition: Of or relating to the body as opposed to the mind.
meanings.sent1: She felt the physical pain in her arm after falling.
meanings.sent2: Exercise is important for maintaining good physical health.
meanings.sent3: The physical comedy in the movie made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The physical weight of grief felt heavy on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The physical presence of the mountain was awe-inspiring.

meanings.sent1: The physical game of rugby requires strength and agility.
meanings.sent2: Hugs are a simple way to show physical affection.
meanings.sent3: The physical challenge of the obstacle course was exciting.
meanings.sent4: The physical clash between the two players was intense.
meanings.sent5: The physical sensation of the warm sun on her skin was comforting.

meanings.definition: Tangible or concrete rather than abstract.
meanings.sent1: The physical evidence supported the detective's theory.
meanings.sent2: She needed physical proof before believing the story.
meanings.sent3: The physical representation of the concept was creative.
meanings.sent4: The physical boundaries of the property were clearly marked.
meanings.sent5: The physical touch of the sculpture revealed its texture.
